Title: WIMA to give one million women farmers access to agricultural technologies
Summary: The Women in Mechanisation Agriculture (WIMA) has unveiled plans to provide mechanisation services to one million women farmers across Nigeria by the year 2030 . The organisation’s President, Aisha Yakubu Bako, said the plans were made at the launch of WIMA in Abuja .

Title: Judicial staff suspend strike, to resume work Wednesday
Summary: The Judiciary Staff Union of Nigeria (JUSUN) has suspended its nationwide industrial action declared on Monday . Chief Justice of Nigeria, Hon. Justice Kudirat Motunmori Olatokunbo Kekere-Ekun, and other key stakeholders . In a statement issued, JUSUN said strike will resume Wednesday

Title: Taraba, four other states to benefit from World Bank livestock project — Abubakar
Summary: Taraba State has been named as one of five Nigerian states selected to benefit from the World Bank-supported Livestock Productivity and Resilience Support Project (L-Pres) The project aims to boost livestock production and enhance resilience in the sector .

Title: HAJJ 2025: Saudi Arabia implores pilgrims to stay indoors over extreme heat
Summary: Hajj Minister Tawfiq al-Rabiah advised pilgrims that are undergoing the 2025 Hajj to stay indoors as a result of the extreme heat that has permeated Mecca City . Many of the pilgrims, many of whom are from Saudi Arabia, are from Nigeria .

Title: Lagos to restore 30 monuments, reconstruct burnt theatre
Summary: Lagos State Government said it is currently working on the restoration of 30 monuments located in different parts of the state . According to the Commissioner for Tourism, Arts and Culture, Mrs. Toke Benson-Awoyinka, the effort is being done .

Title: Security agents kills 32 suspected bandits in Niger State
Summary: Joint security taskforce neutralized 32 suspected bandits during fierce gun battle . Gun battle followed an attempted attack on Kuchi community in Munya Local Government Area of Niger State .

Title: Insecurity: Army chief meets Gov. Alia, seeks collaboration to end killings in Benue
Summary: The Chief of Army Staff (COAS), Lieutenant General Olufemi Oluyede, appealed to the government and people of Benue State to support military efforts in ending the persistent killings and attacks plaguing communities .

Title: 2027: Kaduna PDP Chair vows to dislodge APC, usher in better government
Summary: The People's Democratic Party (PDP) in Kaduna State has said that it will dislodge the ruling All Progressive Congress (APC) in the 2027 general elections, and bring in a better government .

Title: Six Igbanke communities in Edo trace ancestry to Aguleri, Anambra — Celebrate cultural reunion
Summary: Six communities in Igbanke, Edo State, have traced their ancestral roots to Aguleri in Anambra East Local Government Area . Celebrate cultural reunion marking significant cultural and historical reunion .

Title: Bankers’ Award: Cardoso’s monetary reforms at CBN recognised as model for Africa
Summary: President Bola Tinubu appointed Olayemi Cardoso as Governor of the Central Bank of Nigeria (CBN) in September 2023 . He faced an economy grappling with surging inflation, a volatile exchange rate, and waning investor confidence .

Title: Tony Elumelu expands UBA ownership, buys N43.91bn shares
Summary: Tony Elumelu, Chairman of United Bank for Africa, has acquired an additional N43.91 billion worth of shares in the bank over a two-day period . The transactions were carried out between May 29 and May 30, 2025 . The businessman bought a total of 1,267,669,350 shares at an average price

Title: Katsina declares seven-day Sallah holiday for schools
Summary: The Katsina State government has declared a seven-day public holiday for students to mark the 2025 Eid al-Kabir Sallah celebrations . This is contained in a statement signed by the Ministry Director of Schools .

Title: Man arrested for killing neighbour in Ebonyi with shovel
Summary: Ebonyi State police command has arrested a man, Ezeoke Chidera for killing his 60-year-old neighbour, Mrs. Rose Awoke . The incident occurred at Egugho village, Ezzagu community, in the Ishielu Local Government Area of the state, on Monday .
